column4: I have the floppy mounted and I'm in its /media/floppy/boot/grub directory I made
uh...
My kernal is on a dmraid partition
I just need a boot floppy so I can get in and install GRUB natively
Because grub really hates raid D:<
Well...
I'm having a lot of trouble getting grub to install on that
So for now I'm just trying to get grub up somewhere so I can actually boot
I'm tired of tinkering around on a Live OS
you tried supergrub or reloading the grub bootloader to the mbr
http://www.supergrubdisk.org/
it boots a OS that is broken, small download worth a try. YOU can also reload the grub bootloader to the mbr, we also have a script you can run that will tell what is where in the OS
you can't boot windows then, you can use esaybcd to boot ubuntu from the windows boot.
use easybcd
it is a app that willboot other OS's from the windows boot menu.  http://neosmart.net/EasyBCD/
to be honest the floppy is a waste of time easybcd will do what you want.
here is the free one
FIRST, I need to deal with this error I'm getting when trying to install grub on this raid partition
I didn't pick up the raid never mind.
In rember talking to you in ubuntu-beginners you have randomly spread grub files across your set might you share that with people helping you.
good luck hope you up and running.
you can save the urls to leafpad and put them on a thumb
